t: Today*pn also my complaint is bitter. His*ln hand is heavy despite my groaning.
If*ln only I knew how to find him, so*ln that I could go to his throne.
I*ln would plead my case before him and*ln fill my mouth with arguments.
I*ln would learn how he would answer me; and*ln understand what he would say to me.
Would*ln he prosecute me forcefully? No,*ln he would certainly pay attention to me.
Then*ln an upright man could reason with him, and*ln I would escape from my Judge forever.
If*pn I go east, he is not there, and*ln if I go west, I cannot perceive him.
When*ln he is at work to the north, I cannot see him; when*ln he turns south, I cannot find him.
Yet*ln he knows the way I have taken; when*ln he has tested me, I will emerge as pure gold.
My*ln feet have followed in his tracks; I*ln have kept to his way and not turned aside.
I*ln have not departed from the commands from his lips; I*ln have treasured the words from his mouth more*ln than my daily food.
But*pn he is unchangeable; who can oppose him? He*ln does what he desires.
He*ln will certainly accomplish what he has decreed for me, and*ln he has many more things like these in mind.
Therefore*ln I am terrified in his presence; when*ln I consider this, I am afraid of him.
God*ln has made my heart faint; the*ln Almighty has terrified me.
Yet*ln I am not destroyed by the darkness, by*ln the thick darkness that covers my face.
